Job title: Freelance Data Scientist for an Award-Winning Music Software Company
Job description: Examine the "Meta-Data" dataset with 3000 rows and 380 columns containing Floating-point values ~  for example: "ABC": 0.001 ~  0.001 ~  0.001 ~  0.9990 ~  ....; Look at the "Training" dataset where human trainers wrote that the combination of Row #2 from the "Meta-Data" dataset and the Row #2950 from the "Meta-Data" dataset have a lot in common ~  and human-labelled the combination a "5" on a 1 to 5 similarity scale. This is the value we're trying to predict. The size of the training data is small (low thousands) ~  but can be increased if needed; Use the Training dataset to train your own model that predicts the value on a scale of 1 to 5; Create a tool that can take any 2 random rows from the original Meta-Data dataset and predict their value when combined together; Run a simulation of performing the prediction 100 ~ 000 times and generate a histogram showing the distribution of 1 ~  2 ~  3 ~  4 ~  and 5 values. Show us how long it took you to run the 100 ~ 000 prediction simulation.
Required Skills: Expert knowledge and hands-on past experience with Machine Learning ~  TensorFlow ~  Keras ~  Image Classification ~  SVMs ~  etc.
